definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to finish/to be over/whole/complete/entire
jade annulus
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
to surpass (old)

sentences.english: “Most of the pieces that were stolen from the National Museum will come back,” Mr. Zubaidi said.
sentences.chinese: 國家博物館的大多數被劫文物都會完璧歸趙。

sentences.english: The price of operation is the safe return of Scylla.
sentences.chinese: 手術的代價是把錫拉完璧歸趙。

sentences.english: You can rest assured that those two articles will be returned to you in perfect condition shortly.
sentences.chinese: 你放心，你那兩件東西不久就會完璧歸趙。

to spread/to hand down/to disseminate

after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life

help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords

words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
